alert.note: Alert for Assumption; Lower Terrebonne; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Terrebonne, western Lafourche and southeastern Assumption Parishes through 230 PM CDT... At 159 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Bayou Cane, or 8 miles west of Houma, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Houma, Dulac, Cocodrie, Bayou Cane, Supreme, Labadieville, Gray, Schriever, Tambour Bay Buoy and Lumcon Center Buoy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; Lower Terrebonne; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne
